page.description: Return a 128 bit globally/universally unique identifier (GUID/UUID)
page.discussion: The API_UUIDCREATE() function returns a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID...otherwise known as a Globally unique ID or GUID). This is a 32 character (128 bit) hexadecimal string (not including dashes) that is guaranteed to be completely unique if you have a network card. If you do not have a network card, the number is only guaranteed to be unique to the computer. It calls the internal Win32 API function UuidCreate(). This function would be used any time you need a totally unique number such as a key value in a table.
